content.description: Placeholder Name, Grade. Start at the far right and traverse to the left. End on the Katty Corner.
Stand start on a left hand crimp and right hand slope. Bump up and right, then move directly up the slab on small crimpers. For full value avoid using the big holds to the left on Bingo Bango.
content.location: Far right side of the Pocket Boulder

content.description: SDS same as Katty Corner, move left to the arÃªte and reach around the corner to faint slopers hiden in the moss.  Delicately balance your way around the corner and climb the slab.  For good fun and slab practice reverse it for the downclimb.
content.location: Far left End of the pocket boulder

content.description: Start right hand undercling, left hand crimp (many). Move straight up and lean leftish on the fin up top.
content.location: Right end of the Pocket Boulder

content.description: SDS on right hand side pull and left crimper. Move directly up to gib undercling block, top out easily. Awkward start.
content.location: Just left off of the trail on the Pocket Boulder

content.description: Placeholder name. Above the detached block on the ground mantle up on the ledge.  Commit to a delicate move to reach the top out slopers, move a touch right or reach way back to jugs.  A bit heady wit a sub-par landing, be careful!
content.location: far right side of the main face of the pocket boulder.

content.description: Stand start on right side using large jug at  about head height. Traverse left , then slightly up on a crimper rail. Many ending variations exist. The best (IMO) is to top out in the middle of the boulder using a really high right foot and move out right to a small sloping dish, and more slopes up to the left.

Stand start on the left side of the huge block/flake same as the crimp rail traverse.  Climb straight up through a often mossy crescent to a huge gaston jug on your right side for the topout.

McCauley Variation: "Contact"-Off routes the huge block, SDS on tiny holds make a big move to the ledge, dyno to the high crimp and topout avoiding the large bulb.
Stand start between the pocket problem and the block on two good edges on the crimp rail.  Rock way up and lock off to a couple slopers hidden in the Moss.  There is a SDS project to this line.
content.protection: pads, fall is safe but looks bad.

content.description:
SDS down and right of the Pocket Problem , butt on on a small detached boulder.  Right hand on a low right crimp, left in a choice of pockets.  A tenuous lock-off to small crimps in the half height horizontal.  Work straight up between Pocket and Moss Patches on small slopers to gain the top.

Word has it that it was done back in the day, but name is unknown, placeholder name for now, awaiting confirmation of grade, etc.
content.location: Between the pocket problem and moss patches

content.description:
This problem has long been considered one of Bozoo's classics.  This is a must do if you visit Bozoo.

Start low using small pocket on left and pocketed crimp on right. Fire up to good pocket then back left to the lip and top out on slopers.  Might be a hard three, seems to stand as a Icebreaker V4.
content.location: Left end of the Pocket Boulder

content.description: SDS as for Pocket problem (right) , only climb straight up using a small crescent right facing sidepull. Top out on slopers straight up.
content.location: left end of the Pocket Boulder

content.description: SDS on low left end of boulder. Climb left arete through a tiny deep finger pocket and a small horn to a slopey topout.  This can be done without using any of "The Pocket Problems" holds.
content.location: Far left side of the Pocket Boulder

content.description: Placeholder Name, Grade. Start at the far left and traverse to the right.  End on the pocket boulder warm-up.
